definition: court examination, the top grade imperial exam

sentences.english: The palace examination is an important component of Tang dynasty imperial examination system.
sentences.chinese: 殿試是唐代科舉制的重要組成部分。

sentences.english: Ultimately, article analyzed the three characteristics of the Tang Dynasty Palace.
sentences.chinese: 最後分析了唐代殿試的三個特點。

definition: the triennial provincial imperial exam during the Ming and Qing
Zhang Juzheng (1525-1582), Grand Secretary during the Ming dynasty, credited with bringing the dynasty to its apogee
The Garden of Cultivation in Suzhou, Jiangsu
scholar preparing for imperial examinations (in former times)
Kaifeng as the capital of Northern Song dynasty
members of the Hanlin Imperial Academy 翰林院, employed as imperial secretaries from the Tang onwards
to confer a title upon sb/to dub/to crown/to invest with rank or title
Grand Servant in imperial China, one of the Nine Ministers 九卿[jiu3 qing1]
expert in a specialized field such as medicine, divination or chess, available on call to the emperor (in the Tang and Song dynasties)
to propose (for a job)/to nominate/to recommend
